result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • John D Bodenbach was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Progam.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 38 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge - cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide a DNA sample if not yet provided.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John D Bodenbach in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  
Victim Notification was Complied with.
  
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is Dismissed and Read-In.
Count 3  & 4 is Dismissed by Operation of Law.
Friends and Family of the defendant presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented statements to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  4.5 Years 
Initial Confinement: 1.5  Years
Extended Supervision:  3 Years
38 Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

FINE:  $3,801.00                         
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250.00
Bail to be applied - Balance to be refunded to the posting party.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant taken into custody.
Defendant may be transferred to Dodge - FORTHWITH.
